result.execSummary:
The defendant Oscar C Granados was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

DE will provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

DE will be allowed 72 hours from today to report to DOC due to transportation issues.
DE will comply with all programming recommended by DOC agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: DE has indicated he does not intend to seek PCR

Defendant Oscar C Granados in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF41.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct 2 in 16CF41.  Ct's 1,3 will be DRI.  15CT69 will be DRI.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties, will order sentence withheld, one year probation, DE will pay CC, provide a DNA sample/surcharge, comply with DOC recommendations.  DE has one day credit.  DE will have 72 hours to report to DOC.

Bond will be amended to no physical or verbal abusive contact with victim.  No discussion of the case.   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.

Defendant Oscar C Granados in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond will be amended to no physical or verbal abusive contact with victim.  No discussion of the case.
Review hearing on September 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Oscar C Granados in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CT69. Waive reading of information, enter a plea of NG.  Set for RH 9-20-16 @ 9:30AM   Track cases together.
Paperwork completed with Embrace Program, submitted by YMG.
Dated 6/23/16 from Nancy Hahn to Judge Anderson

Defendant Oscar C Granados in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CT69.  State calls Deputy Michael Beuhler, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Objection by Defense.  Cross by Atty Yonko.  Witness dismissed.  State rests, ask for a bind over.  Court will find probable cause exits, will bind over for JT.  Information filed by the State, Atty prefers to wait for arraignment.  Set for 7-05-16 @ 9:30AM, arraignment.  Atty would like to address bond modification.  DE indicated victim would like contact and would like to return home, would like the bond to say no abusive contact with YMG.  The victim/witness coordinator will contact YMG as to this matter, court will set accordingly.
Preliminary hearing on June 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.
